sen.j: スセリビメは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)。
sen.e: Suseri-bime is a deity (Shinto religion) who appears in the Japanese Mythology.
Suseri-bime is a deity (Shinto religion) who appears in the Japanese Mythology.
Suseri-bime is a deity (Shinto religion) who appears in the Japanese Mythology.

sen.j: スサノオの娘で、大国主の正妻。
sen.e: She is a daughter of Susanoo and a legal wife of Okuninushi.
She is a daughter of Susanoo and a legal wife of Okuninushi.
She is a daughter of Susano and a legal wife of Okuninushi.

sen.j: 『古事記』では須勢理毘売命・須世理毘売命、『先代旧事本紀』では須世理姫と表記する。
sen.e: Her name is written as 須勢理毘売命 (Suserihime-no-mikoto) or 須世理毘売命 (Suseribime-no mikoto) in the Kojiki (The record of Ancient Matters) and 須世理姫 (Suseri-bime) in the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) respectively.
Her name is written as 須勢理毘売命 (Suserihime-no-mikoto) or 須世理毘売命 (Suseribime-no mikoto) in "Kojiki (Record of Ancient Matters") and as 須世理姫 (Suseri-bime) in "Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan").
Her name is written as 須勢理毘売命 (Suserihime no mikoto) or 須世理毘売命 (Suseribime no mikoto) in "Kojiki" (Record of Ancient Matters) and as 須世理姫 (Suseri-bime) in "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除"の位置移動

sen.j: また『出雲国風土記』では須佐能袁命の娘で大穴持命の妻の和加須世理比売命（わかすせりひめ）が登場し、同一の神と考えられる。
sen.e: Wakasuserihime-no-mikoto, who appears in "Izumo no kuni fudoki (Fudoki of Izumo no kuni) as a wife of Onamochi-no-mikoto, is conceived as the same deity.
Wakasuserihime-no-mikoto, who appears in "Izumo no kuni fudoki (Fudoki of Izumo no kuni) as a wife of Onamochi-no-mikoto, is conceived as the same deity.
Wakasuserihime no mikoto, who appears in "Izumo no kuni fudoki" (Fudoki of Izumo Province) as a daughter of Susano no mikoto and a wife of Onamochi no mikoto, is conceived as the same deity.
sen.cmt: daughter of Susano no mikoto補足"補足no kuni→Provinceハイフン削除

sen.j: 神話での記述
sen.e: Descriptions in the Mythology
Descriptions in Mythology
Descriptions in mythology
sen.cmt: 文頭以外の語頭を小文字に

sen.j: 『古事記』では以下のように描かれている。
sen.e: Descriptions in the Kojiki are as follows.
Descriptions in the Kojiki are as follows:
Descriptions in the Kojiki are as follows:

sen.j: 詳細は大国主の神話を参照。
sen.e: Concerning the details, refer to the mythology of Okuninushi.
Please refer to the mythology of Okuninushi for details.
Please refer to the mythology of Okuninushi for details.

sen.j: 父の須佐乃男命とともに根の国に住んでいたが、葦原中国から八十神たちの追跡を逃れるために根の国を訪れた大穴牟遅命（＝大国主）と出会い、一目見てすぐに結婚した。
sen.e: While living in Nenokuni (under world) together with her father Susanoo-no-mikoto, she met Onamuji-no-mikoto (=Okuninushi) who came from Ashihara no nakatsukuni to Nenokuni in order to escape from the chase by Yasogami (many deities) and married him at first sight.

While living in Nenokuni (the underworld) together with her father Susanoo-no-mikoto, she met Onamuji-no-mikoto (i.e., Okuninushi), who had come from Ashihara no nakatsukuni to Nenokuni in order to escape the pursuing Yasogami (many deities), and married him at first sight.

While living in Nenokuni (the underworld) together with her father Susano no mikoto, she met Onamuji no mikoto (i.e., Okuninushi), who had come from Ashihara no nakatsukuni to Nenokuni in order to escape the pursuing Yasogami (many deities), and married him at first sight.
sen.cmt: 名前表記ハイフン削除スペース削除

sen.j: 須勢理毘売命が家に帰って大穴牟遅命を父に紹介したところ、父は大穴牟遅命を蛇のいる部屋や蜂とムカデのいる部屋に寝させた。
sen.e: When Suseribime-no-mikoto introduced Onamuji-no-mikoto to her father after returning home, her father got him to sleep in the room where snakes were around or the room where beans and centipedes were around.

When Suseribime-no-mikoto introduced Onamuji-no-mikoto to her father after returning home, her father got him to sleep in the room inhabited by snakes or the room in which there were beans and centipedes.

When Suseribime no mikoto introduced Onamuji no mikoto to her father after returning home, her father got him to sleep in the room inhabited by snakes or the room in which there were beans and centipedes.

sen.j: 須勢理毘売命は呪具である「比礼」を大穴牟遅命に与えてこれを救った。
sen.e: Suserubime-no-mikoto saved Onamuji-no-mikoto by giving him "hire (sash)", a magic tool.
Suseribime-no-mikoto saved Onamuji-no-mikoto by giving him "hire (sash)," a magic tool.
Suseribime no mikoto saved Onamuji no mikoto by giving him 'hire (sash),' a magic tool.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除原文の「」に合わせ"を'に

sen.j: また、須佐乃男命が頭の虱を取るよう命じ、実際にはムカデがいたのだが、須勢理毘売命は木の実と赤土を大穴牟遅命に与え、ムカデを噛み潰しているように見せかけるよう仕向けた。
sen.e: Further, when Susanoo-no-mikoto ordered Onamuji-no-mikoto to rid his hair of lice, actually there were centipedes, she gave nuts and red clay to Onamuji-no-mikoto and induced him to pretend that he is chewing centipedes.

Further, when Susanoo-no-mikoto ordered Onamuji-no-mikoto to rid his hair of lice, but actually there were centipedes, she gave nuts and red clay to Onamuji-no-mikoto and induced him to pretend that he was chewing centipedes.

Further, when Susano no mikoto ordered Onamuji no mikoto to rid his hair of lice, but actually there were centipedes, she gave nuts and red clay to Onamuji no mikoto and induced him to pretend that he was chewing centipedes.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除名前表記

sen.j: 須佐乃男命は安心して眠ってしまった。
sen.e: Then, Susanoo-no-mikoto fell into sleep at ease.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Susanoo-no-mikoto then slept at ease.
Susano no mikoto then slept at ease.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除名前表記

sen.j: その間に大穴牟遅命が須佐乃男命の髪を部屋の柱に縛りつけ、生大刀と生弓矢と天詔琴を持って須勢理毘売命を背負って逃げ出した。
sen.e: In the meantime, Onamuji-no-mikoto bound Susanoo-no-mikoto's hair to the pillar of room and ran away with Iku-tachi sword, Iku-yumiya bow and Amenonorigoto harp in his hands and Suseribime-no-mikoto on his back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Meanwhile, Onamuji-no-mikoto bound Susanoo-no-mikoto's hair to the pillar of the room and ran away with the Iku-tachi sword, Iku-yumiya bow and Amenonorigoto harp in his hands, with Suseribime-no-mikoto on his back.

Meanwhile, Onamuji no mikoto bound Susano no mikoto's hair to the pillar of the room and ran away with the Iku-tachi sword, Iku-yumiya bow and Amenonorigoto harp in his hands, with Suseribime no mikoto on his back.
sen.cmt: 名前表記ハイフン削除

sen.j: 須佐乃男命は追いつけず、大穴牟遅命に大国主神の名を与え、須勢理毘売命を本妻とするよう告げた。
sen.e: As Susanoo-no-mikoto couldn't catch up them, he gave Onamuji-no-mikoto the name of "Okuninushi-no-mikoto and told him that he could make Suseribime-no-mikoto his legal wife.
As Susanoo-no-mikoto couldn't catch up to them, he gave Onamuji-no-mikoto the name "Okuninushi-no-mikoto" and told him that he could make Suseribime-no-mikoto his legal wife.
As Susano no mikoto couldn't catch up to them, he gave Onamuji no mikoto the name Okuninushi no mikoto and told him that he could make Suseribime no mikoto his legal wife.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除名前表記原文に『』のない"を削除

sen.j: 大国主は先に八上比売と結婚し子を得ていたが、八上比売は本妻の須勢理毘売命を畏れて木俣神を置いて実家に帰ってしまった。
sen.e: Although Okuninusi had married Yakami-hime earlier and had a child, Yakmi-hime returned to her parents' home leaving Kinomata no kami behind in awe of legal wife Suseribime-no-mikoto.
Although Okuninusi had married Yakami-hime earlier and had a child, Yakmi-hime returned to her parents' home leaving Kinomata no kami behind in awe of the legal wife, Suseribime-no-mikoto.
Although Okuninushi had married Yakami-hime earlier and had a child, Yakami-hime returned to her parents' home leaving Kinomata no kami behind in awe of the legal wife, Suseribime no mikoto.

sen.j: また、八千矛神（＝大国主）が高志国の沼河比売のもとに妻問婚に行ったことに対し須勢理毘売命は激しく嫉妬した。
sen.e: Further, Suseribime-no-mikoto was furiously jealous over Yachihoko no kami's (=Okuninushi's) tsumadoikon visit (a system of marriage in which the husband visits the wife at home) to Nunakawa-hime who was in Koshi-no-kuni.

Moreover, Suseribime-no-mikoto was furiously jealous over Yachihoko no kami's (i.e., Okuninushi's) tsumadoikon visit (a system of marriage in which the husband visits the wife at home) to Nunakawa-hime, who was in Koshi-no-kuni.

Moreover, Suseribime no mikoto was furiously jealous over Yachihoko no kami's (i.e., Okuninushi's) tsumadoikon visit (a system of marriage in which the husband visits the wife at home) to Nunakawa hime, who was in Koshi no kuni.

sen.j: 困惑した八千矛神は大和国に逃れようとするが、それを留める歌を贈り、二神は仲睦まじく出雲大社に鎮座することとなった。
sen.e: Yachihoko no kami tried to run away to Yamato no kuni in perplexity but she presented waka (Japanese poem) urging him not to go, and eventually two deities harmoniously settled at Izumo-taisha Shrine.

Yachihoko no kami, in her confusion, tried to run away, but Yamato no kuni presented a waka (Japanese poem) urging him not to go, and eventually the two deities harmoniously settled at Izumo-taisha Shrine.

Yachihoko no kami, in her confusion, tried to run away, but Yamato no kuni presented a waka (Japanese poem) urging him not to go, and eventually the two deities harmoniously settled at Izumo-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 『出雲国風土記』では神門郡滑狭郷条で大穴持命が和加須世理比売命に妻問いをする様子のみが描かれている。
sen.e: "Izumo no kuni fudoki"only describes the scene of Onamuji-no-mikoto's tsumadoi visit to Wakasuserihime-no-mikoto who was in Namesano-sato, Kando-gun.
"Izumo no kuni fudoki" only describes the scene of Onamuji-no-mikoto's tsumadoi visit to Wakasuserihime-no-mikoto, who was in Namesano-sato, Kando-gun.
"Izumo no kuni fudoki" only describes the scene of Onamuji no mikoto's tsumadoi visit to Wakasuserihime no mikoto, who was in Namesano-sato, Kando-gun.

sen.j: 解説
sen.e: Explanation
Explanation
Explanation

sen.j: 神名の「スセリ」は「進む」の「スス」、「すさぶ」の「スサ」と同根で、勢いのままにどんどん事を行う女神の意である。
sen.e: Her deity name of "suseri" shares the same origin with "susu" of "susumu (advance)" or "susa" of "susabu (act according to impetus) and her name means a goddess who push forward things aggressively according to impetus.

Her deity name of "suseri" has the same origin as "susu" of "susumu (advance)" or "susa" of "susabu (act according to impetus)," and her name means a goddess who pushes forward things aggressively according to impetus.

Her deity name of 'suseri' has the same origin as 'susu' of 'susumu (advance)' or 'susa' of 'susabu (act according to impetus),' and her name means a goddess who pushes forward things aggressively according to impetus.

sen.j: この女神の持つ激情は、神話において根の国における自分の父の試練を受ける夫の危機を救うことに対して発揮されるが、一方で夫の妻問いの相手である沼河比売に対して激しく嫉妬することによっても発揮される。
sen.e: In the mythology, while such passion of this goddess was shown when she saved her husband who was undegoing hardship imposed by her father in Nenokuni, it was also shown when she was furiously jealous over Nunakawa-hime, a partner of her husband's tsumadoi.

In the mythology, while the passion of this goddess was shown when she saved her husband as he underwent the hardship imposed by her father in Nenokuni, it was also shown when she became furiously jealous over Nunakawa-hime, a partner of her husband's tsumadoi.

In the mythology, while the passion of this goddess was shown when she saved her husband as he underwent the hardship imposed by her father in Nenokuni, it was also shown when she became furiously jealous over Nunakawa-hime, a partner of her husband's tsumadoi.

sen.j: この嫉妬の激しさは女神の偉大さを証明するものだという説がある。
sen.e: Some asserts that such furious jealousy proves the greatness of this goddess.
Some have asserted that such furious jealousy proves the greatness of this goddess.
Some have asserted that such furious jealousy proves the greatness of this goddess.

sen.j: 根の国での説話は、結婚相手の父から試練を与えられて、結婚相手の助言や手助けによって克服するという課題婚と呼ばれる神話の形式である。
sen.e: The story in Nenokuni is a form of Mythology called kadaikon (subject marriage) in which a person is imposed hardship by a marriage partner's father but eventually overcomes it with advice or help of a marriage partner.

The story in Nenokuni is a form of mythology called kadaikon (subject marriage), in which a person is subjected to hardship by a marriage partner's father but eventually overcomes it with the advice or help of a marriage partner.

The story in Nenokuni is a form of mythology called kadaikon (subject marriage), in which a person is subjected to hardship by a marriage partner's father but eventually overcomes it with the advice or help of a marriage partner.

sen.j: オオナムジはこの試練をスセリビメの助けを得て乗り越え、正妻としたことにより、真に大国主になることができたと考えられる。
sen.e: It is believed that Onamuji successfully became real Okuninushi only after he overcame this hardship with her help and made Suseri-bime his legal wife.
It is believed that Onamuji successfully became the real Okuninushi only after he overcame this hardship with her help and made Suseri-bime his legal wife.
It is believed that Onamuji successfully became the real Okuninushi only after he overcame this hardship with her help and made Suseri-bime his legal wife.

sen.j: 本居宣長は、大祓詞に登場する「根国底国に坐す祓戸大神（はやさすらひめ）」はスセリビメと同神であるとしている。
sen.e: Norinaga MOTOORI asserts that "Hayasasura-hime residing in Nenokuni Sokonokuni", who appears in Oharae no Kotoba, is the same deity with Suseri-bime.
Norinaga MOTOORI asserts that "Hayasasura-hime residing in Nenokuni Sokonokuni," who appears in Oharae no Kotoba, is the same deity as Suseri-bime.
Norinaga MOTOORI asserts that 'Hayasasura-hime residing in Nenokuni Sokonokuni,' who appears in Oharae no Kotoba, is the same deity as Suseri-bime.

sen.j: 祀られている神社
sen.e: Shrines at which Suseri-bime is enshrined
Shrines at which Suseri-bime is enshrined
Shrines at which Suseri-bime is enshrined

sen.j: 大国主とともに祀られている場合がほとんどである。
sen.e: In most cases, she is enshrined along with Okuninushi.
In most cases, she is enshrined along with Okuninushi.
In most cases, she is enshrined along with Okuninushi.

sen.j: 出雲大社（島根県出雲市）の摂社大神大后神社（御向社）や春日大社（奈良県奈良市）の末社夫婦大国社をはじめ、國魂神社 (いわき市)（福島県いわき市）、那売佐神社（島根県出雲市）、総社宮（岡山県岡山市）、總社（岡山県総社市）などで祀られている。
sen.e: With Okami Okisaki-jinja Shrine (Mimukai-no-yashiro Shrine), sessha (an auxilliary shrine) of Izumo-taisha Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture) and Meoto-daikokusha Shrine, massha (a branch shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture), at the top of the list, she is enshrined at Okunitama-jinja Shrine (Iwaki City) (Iwaki City, Fukushima Prefecture), Namesa-jinja Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture), Soja-gu Shrine (Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture) and Soja Shrine (Soja City, Okayama Prefecture) etc.

With Okami Okisaki-jinja Shrine (Mimukai-no-yashiro Shrine), sessha (an auxiliary shrine) of Izumo-taisha Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture) and Meoto-daikokusha Shrine, massha (a branch shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) at the top of the list, she is enshrined at Okunitama-jinja Shrine (Iwaki City) (Iwaki City, Fukushima Prefecture), Namesa-jinja Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture), Soja-gu Shrine (Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture) and Soja Shrine (Soja City, Okayama Prefecture), etc.

With Okami Okisaki-jinja Shrine (Mimukai-no-yashiro Shrine), sessha (an auxiliary shrine) of Izumo-taisha Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture) and Meoto-daikokusha Shrine, massha (a branch shrine) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) at the top of the list, she is enshrined at Okunitama-jinja Shrine (Iwaki City, Fukushima Prefecture), Namesa-jinja Shrine (Izumo City, Shimane Prefecture), Soja-gu Shrine (Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture) and Soja Shrine (Soja City, Okayama Prefecture), etc.
